title: Is there any evidence of life in outer space? - Quora

response.answer_text: NO. We have not ‘heard’ anything during the 60+ years we have listened in our radio telescopes (SETI), we have not (yet) seen any ‘molecular signatures of life’ in spectra from exo-planets, this may change with the launch of the James Webb space telescope next year. We have also not seen any ‘structures’ (dyson spheres/swarms, ring worlds,…) that would be a sign of intelligent life. In addition, we have no real idea of how life develops ‘from scratch’ so it is difficult to know if it is one-in-a-million chance or one-in-a-trillion, trillion, trillion, trillion, trillion (some scientists think it is even lower than that!).
That depends on whether you consider the International Space Station’s orbit “outer space”.   If not, then no.
